data.text: @JuliaPonsford You're most welcome - one good turn deserves another... I should have warned you about the dialect, I saw one review that read along the lines of "..if you don't have a lump in your throat after reading Woak Hill then you probably haven't understood it..."
@RockwatchUK Oh thank you! I didn’t know the poem or poet. I love that it’s written in Dorset dialect. ❤️

@JuliaPonsford https://t.co/XDfttfpFAg

Got the bugger! Not quite 3 am, but not far off...
@RockwatchUK Yes it’ll bug me too so hope you remember. 🤞🏻 Enjoy your walk!

@JuliaPonsford I won't be beaten by this! Will send to you when I remember 👍
Right, time to walk the dog here, been delightful talking to you 🙂
@JuliaPonsford No, think that it pre-dates his work. This is proper bugging me now! Expect a tweet at 3 am tomorrow morning when it comes back to me...
@RockwatchUK Maybe Larkin? I don't know that line and I'd remember it because it's beautiful.

@JuliaPonsford Pretty certain that it's something "Hill"... about an old man moving his possessions ('sheening with years of handling) into  a new home after the death of his wife... 
My corpus collussum is well and truly constricted trying to remember!
@RockwatchUK If you tell me what it's about I might know. No guarantees but I love sad poems.
